data.representation

Class DataSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.representation.DataSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BOWDataSet, GamesMetaDataCollection, LFeatRepresentation, QuantizedImageDistributionDataSet, QuantizedImageHistogramDataSet

    public class DataSet
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class that defines a dataset. This particular implementation supports dense features and it is extended by several other classes that include additional representational capabilities like bag of words or discrete features.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public static DataSet filterData(DataSet dsetAllFeatures,
                 java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> admissibleFeatures)
                          throws java.lang.Exception

        Parameters:
        dsetAllFeatures - DataSet to filter.
        admissibleFeatures - ArrayList of admissible feature names.
        Returns:
        DataSet that was filtered.

      • countZeroFloatVectors

        public int countZeroFloatVectors()
        Sometimes zero vectors, empty representations, might occur due to I/O errors this method looks it up in the dataset and lets you know if there are any in the data.
        Returns:
        Integer that is the number of empty representations in the data.

      • getEmptyInstanceIndexes

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getEmptyInstanceIndexes()
        Sometimes zero vectors, empty representations, might occur due to I/O errors this method looks it up in the dataset and lets you know if there are any in the data.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of integer indexes of empty instances in the data.

      • removeZeroVectorInstances

        public void removeZeroVectorInstances()
        Sometimes zero vectors, empty representations, might occur due to I/O errors this method looks it up in the data and removes them.

      • mergeDisjointRepresentations

        public static DataSet mergeDisjointRepresentations(DataSet dsetA,
                                   DataSet dsetB)
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
        This method merges two representations of the same data, two disjoint feature sets. If there are any common features between the two DataSet objects, they should first be removed so that only one copy remains.
        Parameters:
        dsetA - First DataSet object to merge.
        dsetB - Second DataSet object to merge.
        Returns:
        Merged DataSet object, the same size but containing both feature representations.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • equalsInFeatureDefinition

        public boolean equalsInFeatureDefinition(DataSet dset)
        Compares the feature definition of this object to a feature definition of another DataSet that is passed as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        dset - DataSet to compare to.
        Returns:
        True if they have equal feature definitions, false otherwise.

      • makeArrayReferencedCopy

        public DataSet makeArrayReferencedCopy()
        This method makes a copy where only the references are genuinely copied. The arrays that store the feature values and attribute names are not copied, so there is no overhead if those values are not going to be modified (but rather the data labels or something like that).
        Returns:
        An array referenced copy of the DataSet.

        public void standardizeCategories()

      • findMaxLabel

        public int findMaxLabel()
        Returns:

                                  CombinedMetric cmet,
                                  int upperBound)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Gets the radius of the volume containing the instances.
        Parameters:
        indexes - Instance indexes.
        cmet - CombinedMetric object for distance calculations.
        upperBound - The index up until which to take data from indexes.
        Returns:
        Radius of the volume containing the instances.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getNonExactRadialVolumeForInstances

        public double getNonExactRadialVolumeForInstances(int[] indexes,
                                         CombinedMetric cmet)
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        The volume isn't multiplied by a constant factor which depends on dimensionality. The reason for this is that it takes time to calculate this factor and it's irrelevant for checking relative densities, since there will get normalized anyway. There is still a problem if the dimensionality is really high, the volume will be enormous.
        Parameters:
        indexes - Instance indexes.
        cmet - CombinedMetric object for distance calculations.
        Returns:
        Radial volume for the given instances, up to a multiplicative constant.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        indexes - Instance indexes.
        Returns:
